result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael John Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael John Ellis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael John Ellis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Participate in any other assessments as deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and follow through with recommended counseling, treatment or programming.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended counseling, treatment or programming.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Ellis

defendant.name: Ellis, Michael John

records.addlTxt:
9:12 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael John Ellis in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Michael John Ellis.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on the sentence agreement. 
State confirms agreement. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court accepts the defendants no contest plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

21CM07 - No Contest 
Ct 2 - 961.573(1) - Possess Drug Paraphernalia (1)

21CM26 - No Contest
Ct 1 - 343.44(1)(b) - Operating While Revoked (1)

22CM20 (with a domestic abuse enhancer) - No Contest
Ct 1 - 947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct (1)

State moves to dismiss Ct 1 in 21CM07 and in Ct 2 in 22CM20. Court dismisses those counts. 
Attorney Erickson is heard on sentencing. Requests probation. 
Defendant comments. 

Court orders: on all three cases-identical conditions, 2 years probation. AODA assessment. Total of 9 days credit. No conditional jail time. Participate and follow through with any recommendations. 
Total for the three cases, plus the domestic abuse assessment. $1429.00. $379.00 balance after bond applied. PP approved $50 pr mo. Commencing on Nov 1st, 2022. $15.00 PPF. 


21CM07 - No Contest 
Ct 2 - 961.573(1) - Possess Drug Paraphernalia (1) - 7 days jail credit 

21CM26 - No Contest
Ct 1 - 343.44(1)(b) - Operating While Revoked (1) - 2 days jail credit

22CM20 (with a domestic abuse enhancer) - No Contest.  
Ct 1 - 947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct (1)

End 9:34 am
